Let's now do the math to calculate the equal speed at which both A and B could be traveling away from a "neutral" observer.

Missed the previous lesson? https://www.khanacademy.org/science/physics/special-relativity/einstein-velocity-addition/v/finding-an-in-between-frame-of-reference?utm_source=YT&utm_medium=Desc&utm_campaign=physics

Physics on Khan Academy: Physics is the study of the basic principles that govern the physical world around us. We'll start by looking at motion itself. Then, we'll learn about forces, momentum, energy, and other concepts in lots of different physical situations. To get the most out of physics, you'll need a solid understanding of algebra and a basic understanding of trigonometry.

snippet.title: Calculating neutral velocity | Special relativity | Physics | Khan Academy

snippet.description:
